newsitem.title: USA: Dade Intl to distribute for Cardiovascular.
newsitem.headline: Dade Intl to distribute for Cardiovascular.

text.p: Dade International said it signed a five-year development and distribution agreement with Cardiovascular Diagnostics Inc in point-of-care hemostasis testing.
Under the agreement, Dade will distribute Cardiovascular's Thrombolytic Assessment System (TAS) for the arrest of bleeding to hospital and non-hospital laboratories.

The companies estimated that the agreement, which calls for increasing annual sales volumes, should result in total sales of more than $100 million in instruments and test cards over the next five years.
The TAS technology analyzes blood-clot formation and dissolution.

Dade manufactures reagents, controls and analyzers for hemostasis testing. Cardiovascular Diagnostics, based in Raleigh, N.C., manufactures systems designed to rapidly deliver blood-test results at the point of care.
